feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 20 at 9:15AM AKDT until October 20 at 4:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM AKDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Blowing snow with low visibility. West winds gusting to 40 mph. Visibility one half mile or less. * WHERE...Over Steese Highway Summits. * WHEN...Until 4 PM AKDT this afternoon.
entry.cap:areaDesc: White Mountains and High Terrain South of the Yukon River

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 20 at 1:06AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Today... Elevated surf will continue today and cause minor beach erosion. Northwest winds to 25 to 35 mph will decrease to 15 mph late this afternoon. The surf will decrease this evening. Residents with items on the beach should move them inland to prevent them from washing away.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northwest Arctic Coast; Western Arctic Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 20 at 1:06AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Through Saturday... Elevated surf will continue today and cause minor beach erosion. Northwest winds will increase to 30 to 40 mph today. The elevated surf will continue through Saturday. Residents with items on the beach should move them inland to prevent them from washing away. People at Utqiagvik should be aware of increased beach erosion
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Beaufort Sea Coast; Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast; Northern Arctic Coast

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 20 at 1:06AM AKDT until October 21 at 6:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with low visibility expected. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting to 40 mph. Visibility one half mile or less at times. * WHERE...Northern Arctic Coast.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 20 at 1:06AM AKDT until October 21 at 4:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM EARLY THIS MORNING TO 4 PM AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Visibility one half mile or less at times. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. Winds gusting to 35 mph. * WHERE...Central Arctic Plains and Central Brooks Range.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Arctic Plains; Central Brooks Range

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 20 at 1:06AM AKDT until October 22 at 6:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with low visibility expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 inches. Winds gusting to 45 mph. Visibility one half mile or less at times. * WHERE...Central Beaufort Sea Coast.

entry.summary: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued October 20 at 4:40AM PDT until October 20 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Surf of 3 to 5 feet with sets to 6 feet and strong rip currents. * WHERE...Orange County Coastal Areas. * WHEN...Through this evening.

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued October 20 at 4:40AM PDT until October 20 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Surf of 4 to 7 feet, with sets to 9 feet on exposed west- facing beaches. Minor coastal flooding during times of high tide. * WHERE...San Diego County Coastal Areas.

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued October 20 at 2:45AM PDT until October 20 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Surf of 4 to 6 feet with local sets to 7 feet is expected through this evening, then surf will subside a bit tonight and Saturday. However, there will be a high risk of dangerous rip currents through Saturday.

entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 10 to 15 feet with local sets to 20 feet are expected on west and northwest facing beaches today. entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM PDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves 6 to 9 feet with local sets to 10 feet are expected today and early tonight. entry.title: Rip Current Statement issued October 20 at 12:36PM EDT until October 21 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents expected. * WHERE...Bay, Gulf, and Franklin County Beaches. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Coastal Bay; Coastal Franklin; Coastal Gulf

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 20 at 9:35AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. .The Saint Johns River near Astor is forecast to continue falling through Minor Flood Stage into next week. For the St. Johns River...including Astor...Minor flooding is forecast.

entry.summary: ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor saltwater flooding. * WHERE...Upper and Middle Florida Keys, especially on the Bayside. * WHEN...Through this afternoon.
